alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 09 at 2:29PM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska counties that border Kansas. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening through 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions with reduced visibility. Most of the expected snow will fall tonight into Thursday morning, which could impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wind will generally be northeasterly at around 15 mph with gusts of 20 to 25 mph. Therefore, some blowing and drifting snow will also be likely. In addition, Thursday morning wind chill values will likely fall to around zero to 5 below zero creating a dangerous situation for anyone that becomes stranded outdoors.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Furnas; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster
